SWX_CCSDS_SPKT_HANDLER

 [Previous Routine] [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
 Purpose: Decomutate a single CCSDS data packet and uses the apid to retrieve an object that can process the specific APID
 Input:  byte array that containing a single CCSDS data packet
 
 Written by Davin Larson

SWX_SPC_MET_TO_UNIXTIME

 [Previous Routine] [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
Function:  swx_spc_met_to_unixtime
Purpose:  Convert MET (mission Elapsed Time) to Unix Time  (which is almost equivalent to UTC)
see also:  "swx_spc_unixtime_to_met" for the reverse conversion
 This routine is in the process of being modified to use SPICE Kernels to correct for clock drift as needed.
 Author: Davin Larson
 $LastChangedBy: davin-mac $
 $LastChangedDate: 2024-11-01 10:09:46 -0700 (Fri, 01 Nov 2024) $
 $LastChangedRevision: 32916 $
 $URL: svn+ssh://thmsvn@ambrosia.ssl.berkeley.edu/repos/spdsoft/trunk/projects/swx/swx_spc_met_to_unixtime.pro $

(See projects/swx/swx_spc_met_to_unixtime.pro)

SWX_SPICE_KERNELS

 [Previous Routine] [Next Routine] [List of Routines] 
NAME: swx_SPICE_KERNELS
PURPOSE:
 Provides swx spice kernel filename of specified type

Typical CALLING SEQUENCE: kernels=swx_spice_kernels()

KEYWORDS:
 LOAD:   Set keyword to also load file
 TRANGE:  Set keyword to UT timerange to provide range of needed files.
 RECONSTRUCT: If set, then only ephemeris (spk) kernels with reconstructed data (no predicts) are returned.

OUTPUT: fully qualified kernel filename(s)
WARNING: Be very careful using this routine with the /LOAD keyword.

It will change the loaded SPICE kernels that users typically assume are not being changed.
PLEASE DO NOT USE this routine within general "LOAD" routines using the LOAD keyword.
"LOAD" routines should assume that SPICE kernels are already loaded.

 Author: Davin Larson
 $LastChangedBy: davin-mac $
 $LastChangedDate: 2023-12-02 00:05:21 -0800 (Sat, 02 Dec 2023) $
 $LastChangedRevision: 32261 $
 $URL: svn+ssh://thmsvn@ambrosia.ssl.berkeley.edu/repos/spdsoft/trunk/projects/swx/swx_spice_kernels.pro $

(See projects/swx/swx_spice_kernels.pro)
